private int img1, img2, img3;
private int[] images = {R.drawable.img1, R.drawable.img2, R.drawable.img3};
private int currentImage = 0;
private Handler mHandler = new Handler();
private Runnable mRunnable = new Runnable() {
    @Override
    public void run() {
        currentImage = (currentImage + 1) % images.length;
        ImageView imageView = (ImageView) findViewById(images[currentImage]);
        imageView.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
        mHandler.postDelayed(this, 500);
    }
};

public void startAnimation() {
    img1 = images[0];
    ImageView imageView = (ImageView) findViewById(img1);
    imageView.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
    mHandler.postDelayed(mRunnable, 500);
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates a simple animation using multi-images. It starts by setting the first image as visible and then posting a delay of 500 milliseconds using the Handler. In the Runnable, the current image is incremented by 1 and then set to the previous image. This process repeats every 500 milliseconds, cycling through all three images. The startAnimation() method sets the first image as visible and starts the animation.
